card1.title: Meet scUber
card1.intro: Introducing a world first on the Great Barrier Reef
body: Travel like never before, exploring Australia's Great Barrier Reef in the world's first rideshare submarine, scUber.

Uber and Queensland, Australia are giving riders the opportunity to delve into the depths of one of the world's greatest natural wonders, the Great Barrier Reef, and discover a breathtaking underwater playground.
From May 27 to June 18, 2019, this once-in-a-lifetime experience will provide riders with an authentic view of an extraordinary underwater world, rich and diverse in marine life.

There are two ways to experience scUber: for participating countries, you can enter the global competition; or riders in selected Queensland cities will have the opportunity to request a scUber ride directly in the Uber app.

card2.title: WIN! a ride in scUber
card2.intro: You and a friend can WIN a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Australia's Great Barrier Reef to experience the ride of your lives in scUber.
body: For your chance to win, enter the competition (hyperlink to competition page) and tell us in 25 words or less why you should experience the wonder of the Great Barrier Reef with scUber.

card3.title: How to request a ride with scUber
body: For a limited time only, Uber riders in selected Queensland cities will have the opportunity to request a scUber experience directly through the app. These numbers are strictly limited so availability cannot be guaranteed.
If you're an Uber rider in Gladstone, Cairns, Palm Cove or Port Douglas, find out what dates (hyperlink to in app page) are available to request a scUber experience in your city.
The cost of each scUber experience is $3,000 for two people.

card4.title: Take a deep dive
card4.intro: Here's what else makes it so great:
body: It's the world-famous attraction that carries some sizeable tags – largest reef system and largest living organism on the planet – so it's no surprise that there are big experiences to be had on the Great Barrier Reef.
scUber is a new way to have a completely immersive underwater experience in the home of 3,000 individual reefs, 900 islands and over 1,500 species of fish.

list.text: It represents approximately 10% of all coral reefs in the world.
The Great Barrier Reef is the size of about 70 million football fields.
It's the largest natural feature on earth and is the only living structure that can be seen from the moon.
The Great Barrier Reef is home to the 'Great 8' marine encounters: whales, turtles, manta rays, clown fish, sharks, potato cod, Maori wrasse and the giant clam.

The Reef is the world's largest and longest coral reef system, stretching for 2,300km from the tip of Cape York in the north to Bundaberg in the south. That's about the distance between New York and Dallas!
A World Heritage Area since 1981 and the world's first reef ecosystem to be recognised by UNESCO, the Great Barrier Reef is highly protected and one of the best-managed marine areas on Earth.

card5.title: Protecting the Reef
body: The ongoing preservation and sustainable protection of the Great Barrier Reef is one of global importance. Uber is proud to announce their partnership with the Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef to support their conservation initiatives for the world's largest ecosystem.

Uber will be donating $100,000 to Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef to help support their Reef conservation programs and will also be donating the equivalent value of every scUber ride taken to this important organisation.
Learn more about the partnership and the conservation programs by Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef.

entry.title: To celebrate the launch of scUber, Queensland, Australia and Uber are giving one lucky person and a friend the opportunity to win a trip to Australia's Great Barrier Reef.
entry.intro: For your chance to win, tell us in 25 words or less why you should experience the wonder of the Great Barrier Reef with scUber.
entry.prize_package_intro: Win a trip for two people from the United Kingdom including:
prize_package_list: Return economy airfares from your nearest International airport to Cairns
Return airport transfers from Cairns Airport to hotel
5 nights' accommodation staying at Riley, a Crystalbrook Collection Resort
Experience of a lifetime on the Great Barrier Reef with Quicksilver Cruises and Nautilus Aviation including a ride in scUber at Agincourt Reef
Cape Tribulation, Daintree & Mossman Day Tour
$250 AUD Uber credit for use in the Uber and Uber Eats app
body: The competition closes June 1, 2019 (2pm AEST) and winners will be announced on June 3, 2019 (10am AEST).

confirmation.title: CONGRATULATIONS, YOU'RE IN THE DRAW!
body: Thanks for entering the competition to experience the Great Barrier Reef with scUber!  Winners will be selected and notified by email at 10am (AEST) on Monday 3 June 2019.
Get set to embark on an awesome ocean adventure and don't forget to share with your friends.

ondemand.heading: scUber On Demand
ondemand.title: How to request a scUber ride
ondemand.intro: Uber and Queensland, Australia are offering a limited number of people the chance to delve into the depths of one of the world's greatest natural wonders – the Great Barrier Reef – and explore a breathtaking underwater playground. For some lucky people, it all starts with a simple tap on the Uber app.
body: How to request a ride with scUber
We want to showcase the incredible Great Barrier Reef with this once-in-a-lifetime chance to explore the world's largest ecosystem.
For a limited time only, a select number of Uber riders in selected Queensland cities will have the chance to request a scUber experience directly through the app.
If you're an Uber rider in Gladstone, Cairns, Port Douglas or Palm Cove, you can request a scUber experience on the following dates:
Gladstone - 27th May, 28th May, 30th May, 31 May, 2nd June, 3rd June;
Port Douglas, Palm Cove and Cairns - 9th June, 11th June, 12th June, 14th June, 15th June 17th June, 18th June
Please note just one trip for two will become available daily in each location. These numbers are strictly limited so availability cannot be guaranteed.
The cost of each scUber experience will be $3,000 for two people. Uber will match the cost of all scUber rides and donate the equivalent amount to Citizens of the Great Barrier Reef.
Find out more details about the full scUber experience here.
The experience includes:
list: Pickup and drop-off from your location in a scUber car
Chopper ride to and from Gladstone to Heron Island or from Cairns or Port Douglas to Agincourt Reef
Car back to your original pick up address
3. Wait for your ride to be confirmed (as there is only one per day)
4. An Uber team member will then ring you and talk you through where you need to be
20 rides will be available throughout the 4 weeks which means 40 riders will get to experience the Great Barrier Reef like never before in a fully submersible submarine
At 7.30am each morning scUber becomes available for riders to request within the geo fence (see maps below)
ONE request is accepted (first-come-first-serve). Maximum seats you can book is 2
You must be available for travel each day at 9am on the day you select your scUber ride (So you need to be ready!)
scUber rides will be 1 hour in length
You should be returned back to your original pick up address by 4.30pm on the day of travel
disclaimer: The scUber experience is strictly limited and available for a limited time only. A scUber request can only be made using the Uber app on or after 7.30am on specified dates (set out below), for travel on the same date. A successful scUber request will be confirmed no later than 8:30am on the date it was requested and all riders must be available to commence travel by 9am on the same day. Uber does not guarantee availability of scUber rides. Each scUber trip is priced at $3000 for two riders. Where only one rider can attend, the full cost of the scUber trip remains due and payable. All passengers must satisfy certain physical and legal requirements. Please note, Uber is not a submarine operator and all scUber rides will be operated by Aquatica Submarines.
The specified dates for each of the participating geographical area are as follows:
Gladstone - 27th May, 28th May, 30th May, 31 May, 2nd June, 3rd June;
Port Douglas, Palm Cove and Cairns - 9th June, 11th June, 12th June, 14th June, 15th June, 17th June, 18th June
These dates may change due to inclement weather.

closed.title: The competition is now closed.
body: Winners will be announced on June 3, 2019 (10am AEST).
Good luck!

sections.intro: Envie de partir pour le Queensland?  Découvrez les meilleures offres d'hébergement, de visites, d'attractions et bien pus encore.

deals.heading: QUEENSLAND À CONTRE-COURANT, DE CAIRNS À BRISBANE
deals.description: Dévouvrez les joyaux de la côte Est :  forêt pluviale de Daintree, plages dorées de Port Douglas, l'archipel des Whitsundays, Fraser Island. Un parcours classique mais à contre-sens des itinéraires classiques.

deals.heading: ROADTRIP DANS LA DAINTREE
deals.description: Une fabuleuse échappée en 4×4, à la croisée de la forêt pluviale de Daintree et de la Grande Barrière de Corail. Un itinéraire aux paysages multiples, entre mer de corail et jungle primaire.

deals.heading: MERVEILLES DU QUEENSLAND
deals.description: Hébergement au milieu de la forêt tropicale à Narrows Escape (Sunshine Coast). Séjour dans une ferme australienne à Rockhampton avec dîner-barbecue. Croisière dans l'archipel des Whitsundays. Observation des ornithorynques dans le parc national Eungella.

deals.heading: D'ÎLE EN ÎLE SUR LA CAPRICORN COAST
deals.description: Visitez Fraser Island, la plus grande île de sable du monde hors des sentiers battus. Lady Musgrave et son lagon turquoise au cœur de la Grande Barrière de Corail. Assistez à la nidification, la ponte ou l'éclosion des tortues de mer à Mon Repos.

deals.heading: BIENVENUE À CAIRNS
deals.description: Une escale idéale pour découvrir Cairns. Une région unique ou la forêt tropicale et la Grande Barrière de Corail se rencontrent.

deals.heading: BIENVENUE À PORT DOUGLAS
deals.description: Plongée et les activités nautiques autour de la Grande Barrière de corail. Forêt tropicale de Daintree, pour une évasion au cœur de la nature. Les magnifiques plages bordées de cocotiers. Demi-journée en compagnie d'un guide aborigène.
